alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 6:03PM EDT until September 08 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cheshire County in southern New Hampshire... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 603 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hinsdale to 18 miles south of Winchester, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Keene, Jaffrey, Winchester, Antrim, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Nelson, Marlborough, Rindge, Swanzey, Hinsdale, Roxbury, Fitzwilliam, Stoddard, Troy, Sullivan, Chesterfield, Gilsum, and Hancock. This also includes... Mount Monadnock. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
